intro: Tricoryne soullierae, commonly known as the Soullier's tricoryne, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with palmate leaves that have five to seven lobes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
